commands.name: Create New React Component
commands.description: Generates a new React JavaScript component with tests, documentation, and README updates.

componentName.description: Name of the new React component

commands.prompt:
You are a senior frontend engineer working on a large-scale React + JavaScript + Jest project. Create a new React component named {{componentName}}.

Requirements:
1. Use JavaScript (.js or .jsx) - NOT TypeScript
2. Create functional component with React hooks if needed
3. Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation with @param, @returns, @example
4. Include PropTypes for prop validation
5. Create comprehensive Jest tests using @testing-library/react
6. Follow the project's existing component structure
7. Ensure component is reusable and well-documented
8. Add proper error handling and edge cases
9. Include accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
10. Use semantic HTML elements
11. Update README.md with component documentation
12. Export component properly

Generate:
- Component file: src/components/{{componentName}}/{{componentName}}.js (or .jsx)
- Test file: src/components/{{componentName}}/{{componentName}}.test.js
- CSS/SCSS file if needed: src/components/{{componentName}}/{{componentName}}.css
- Index file: src/components/{{componentName}}/index.js
- Update README.md with component documentation

Make sure all code follows JavaScript best practices and React patterns.

commands.name: Create New Feature or Function
commands.description: Creates a new JavaScript function with JSDoc, Jest tests, documentation, and README update.

featureName.description: Name of the new function or feature to generate

commands.prompt:
You are a senior JavaScript developer. Create a new function or feature named {{featureName}}.

Requirements:
1. Use JavaScript (.js) - NOT TypeScript
2. Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation with @param, @returns, @throws, @example
3. Include proper parameter validation and error handling
4. Create comprehensive Jest tests covering all edge cases
5. Follow the project's existing function/utility structure (typically src/utils/ or src/helpers/)
6. Ensure function is pure and well-documented
7. Add TypeScript-style JSDoc type annotations using @param {Type} and @returns {Type}
8. Include usage examples in JSDoc
9. Update README.md with function documentation
10. Export function properly

Generate:
- Function file: src/utils/{{featureName}}.js (or appropriate directory)
- Test file: src/utils/{{featureName}}.test.js
- Update README.md with function documentation

Make sure all code follows JavaScript best practices and includes comprehensive error handling.

commands.name: Create New Page (React Route)
commands.description: Generates a full React page component with React Router integration, tests and documentation.

pageName.description: Route name for the new page

commands.prompt:
You are a senior React engineer working with Create React App and React Router. Create a new page component named {{pageName}}.

Requirements:
1. Use JavaScript (.js or .jsx) - NOT TypeScript
2. Create a page component that can be used with React Router
3. Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation
4. Include PropTypes for prop validation
5. Create comprehensive Jest tests using @testing-library/react
6. Follow the project's existing page structure (typically src/pages/)
7. Ensure page is responsive and accessible
8. Include proper error boundaries if needed
9. Add loading states and error handling
10. Use semantic HTML elements
11. Update README.md with page documentation
12. If React Router is not installed, note it in documentation

Generate:
- Page file: src/pages/{{pageName}}/{{pageName}}.js (or .jsx)
- Test file: src/pages/{{pageName}}/{{pageName}}.test.js
- CSS file: src/pages/{{pageName}}/{{pageName}}.css
- Index file: src/pages/{{pageName}}/index.js
- Update README.md with page documentation

Make sure all code follows JavaScript best practices and React Router patterns.

commands.name: Create Responsive UI Component
commands.description: Generates a new responsive and mobile-friendly React JavaScript UI component with CSS/Tailwind CSS, tests, and documentation.

componentName.description: Name of the new responsive UI component

description.description: Brief description of what the component does

commands.prompt:
You are a senior frontend engineer specializing in responsive design and mobile-first development. Create a new responsive and mobile-friendly React JavaScript UI component named {{componentName}} of type {{componentType}}.{{#if description}} Description: {{description}}{{/if}}

Requirements:
1. Use JavaScript (.js or .jsx) - NOT TypeScript
2. Use CSS with mobile-first responsive design (media queries: @media (min-width: 768px), etc.) or Tailwind CSS if installed
3. Component must be fully responsive and work seamlessly on mobile (320px+), tablet (768px+), and desktop (1024px+)
4. Implement touch-friendly interactions (minimum 44x44px touch targets)
5. Use flexible layouts (flexbox/grid) that adapt to screen sizes
6. Ensure proper spacing and typography scaling across breakpoints
7. Include proper accessibility (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus states)
8. Add hover and active states for desktop, touch states for mobile
9. Use semantic HTML elements
10. Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation with PropTypes
11. Create comprehensive Jest tests using @testing-library/react
12. Follow the project's existing component structure in src/components/ui/
13. Ensure the component is reusable and composable
14. Add responsive utilities for hiding/showing elements at different breakpoints
15. Consider landscape/portrait orientation changes
16. Optimize for performance (React.memo, useMemo, useCallback where appropriate)
17. Include dark mode support if applicable (using CSS variables or theme context)
18. Use CSS Modules or scoped styles to avoid conflicts

Generate:
- Component file: src/components/ui/{{componentName}}/{{componentName}}.js (or .jsx)
- Test file: src/components/ui/{{componentName}}/{{componentName}}.test.js
- CSS file: src/components/ui/{{componentName}}/{{componentName}}.css
- Index file: src/components/ui/{{componentName}}/index.js
- Update README.md with component documentation

Make sure the component follows mobile-first principles and provides an excellent user experience across all device sizes. Use JavaScript best practices and React patterns.
